{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3503685,"name":"FredK","username":"FredK","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/71e660/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-06T01:44:15.628Z","cooked":"

We are trying to mount a sideways elevator to an AM 14U6 chassis and are struggling with the bracing supports because the outer rails of the chassis are so narrow they won’t support 1" wide brackets. Tried to search CD but our search terms didn’t find a lot. We can manufacture custom brackets but cannot mill. Any photos or suggestions would be appreciated.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-02-06T01:44:15.628Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":148,"readers_count":147,"score":59.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":485391,"topic_slug":"looking-for-ideas-or-examples-of-mounting-to-the-am-14u6-chassis-rails","display_username":"FredK","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31768,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/looking-for-ideas-or-examples-of-mounting-to-the-am-14u6-chassis-rails/485391/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3503703,"name":"NathanNFM","username":"NathanNFM","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathannfm/{size}/181060_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-06T02:01:09.823Z","cooked":"

There is a 1" hole pattern on the vertical face, you should be able to attach a bracket or box tube directly to that and have it protrude up vertically (like the KitBot), or at an angle if you are doing a diagonal brace.

You can also lay a piece of box tube or pre-drilled tube across the top of the rails then tie into that anywhere along it.

Pictures of what you have now might let us suggest some good tie points.

PXL_20250206_1147398441920×2550 908 KB

Were hoping to find a corner bracket like this that would attach to the top of the outer rail without violating the frame perimeter. Or a way to attach a 1x1 to the top of the rail without the same problem. But thank you for the other suggestion. That may be the only answer.

Can’t find a great photo, we did exactly this in 2023 with that Rev corner bracket. We turned so it would be oriented to where it fit within frame and ran a piece of aluminum between the drive rails for the brace to sit on. We also used 1x1 as the brace.

IMG_23833024×4032 2.35 MB

FredK:

Were hoping to find a corner bracket like this that would attach to the top of the outer rail without violating the frame perimeter. Or a way to attach a 1x1 to the top of the rail without the same problem. But thank you for the other suggestion. That may be the only answer.

Nathan knows his stuff on this (and, frustratingly, at building cardboard robots #stillsaltyabout2020).

The inside of the plates is the sauce; we used it to great effect in 2021 and 2023.

image1320×968 87.9 KB

IMG_20921920×2560 512 KB

Any of the COTS gussets would let you do that for a tube going vertical.

Two other notes:

  1. 1" tube on the outside plate is probably going to alter what your robot perimeter looks like. That can be worked around, just know that.
  2. I have a strong distaste for mounting things to the outside plate of an AM14U, as any repair issue with the drivetrain means significantly more disassembly work. If you can refactor the design to grab the front/rear C-shaped pieces instead (or just grab the inside plates), it’ll be to your benefit.
